summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Norman Street, from Twenty-third Avenue South, on the south, to Twenty-sixth Avenue South; Charles Street, from Twentieth Avenue South to Twenty-sixth Avenue South; Twenty-fifth Avenue South, from Dearborn Street to Norman Street; Twenty-second Avenue South, from Dearborn Street to Charles Street; and Twenty-second Avenue South, on the east side, from Charles Street to Norman Street, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing concrete sidewalks, with all necessary appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 614 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
